  1. I've had this set for two years now. I've recharged the battery twice. Great product if your unsightly ear and nose hair needs professional removal. the other attachments work well too.

  5. This is an inexpensive groomer that has quite a few features. The only thing I don't like is that when you are charging it, you have no idea if it is fully charged or not. A blinking light or some indication that it is fully charged would be nice. Adjustments work well, and it gives a clean finish to your shave.
  6. It works good, It has all functionality one may need. And for information. Philips uses the same materials as for expensive models so the quality is guaranteed.
  7. Excellent trimmer, charges just fine, with easy cleanup.
  8. I've never had a beard trimmer before (nor a beard). These trimmers make it pretty easy to maintain it at just the length that I like. I got it mainly for the beard trimmer attachment. The nose hair, precision trimmer, and foil shaver attachments work well too. The full length trimmer works pretty well, but even the longest length is practically a buzz cut, I wish the lengths extended to even longer. Overall it's great, and it's convenient that it has a rechargeable battery in it. I'm not enamored by it, but I like it :)
  9. I have the Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System, had it less than a year. The battery is the main issue...it will not stay charged more than one day - even when not used. Other trimmer parts seem to work pretty well...except the rotary hair/nose hair clipper pulls (yikes!) out about as many hairs as it cuts. The clippers, are supposed to be washable, rust pretty quickly if you don't get ALL the water out. It helps to add a very light amount of clipper oil to keep these running smoothly.<br />Main problem is that Phillips Norelco wants me to pay shipping and insurance so they can evaluate my G370...must have receipt (who keeps these?), etc. and this is just to decide if they'll honor their 2 year warranty. By the time I pay for shipping, and the time it takes to do all this, I may as well get a different clipper.<br />All for the lack of a decent battery...you should be ashamed Phillips Norelco!
  10. Ive had this trimmer for about 6 months now. I mainly use it to cut my hair and its done a pretty good job.<br />But here are a couple of problems with this trimmer.<br />The first has to do wit the beard trimming attachment. The first time i used it, it cut me under my chin and it was so painful!!! Which made me not use it for a couple of weeks and when i did use it again it did the exact same thing!!! Hopefully ive learned my lesson.<br />The second and WORST problem it has, is that you cant use it and charge it at the same time.<br />I knew you couldnt when i bought it cause i had read it in the reviews. But i didnt think it was going to be so inconvenient. I thought to my self \\"oh ill just make sure its always charged\\". Easier said than done!<br />Time and time again it has died in the middle of me cutting my hair. And it wouldnt be so bad if it charged quickly but it doesnt!! An hour long charge only last me about 30 seconds to 1 minute of usage!! Its insane!!!<br />So just take my advice and buy a better trimmer because i guarantee you the same things that happened to me will happen to you
  11. This is the second time I've bought this trimmer, though the first one was gray and had a stand. I now know what I did wrong with the first one and why they did not include the stand this time. DO NOT RECHARGE this device until it needs recharging. I charged it once a year ago when I purchased it and keep a very stylized beard and it's still going strong on that one charge. My previous trimmer lasted me a couple of years but that was with me constantly charging it in the stand. I kept the old stand but I don't plug it in.
  12. The razor's cutting units were very sharp and got the job done, quick, fast, and in a hurry!!! Would definitely recommended this product to others!

  22. To start, I didnt expect this to be the best device in terms of quality and longevity for $19.00 but it holds its own in terms of bang for the buck. I decided to give it the first couple weeks of home use and then my most recent 10 day vacation of use before writing my review. The G370 does a really good job on daily facial hair maintenance. I used the mini foil shaver, both edge trimmers and the nose/ear hair trimmer. I havent used the 2 hair/head trimmer attachments as I really didnt need to with a 3 week haircut regimen. The mini foil attachment really surprised me, it really got me by during my vacation in the areas I wanted the least amount of hair. It doesnt replace my actual razor at home but sufficed well while out of town for more than a week. The larger of the two edge trimmers I used as a chin and beard groomer for the days I opted for the 5 o' clock shadow look and the smaller edge trimmer really helps in the fine line areas of trimming as well as touching up around the ears/hairline. I used the nose/ear trimmer a couple times and it works pretty good, well enough I didnt get bothered by nose hairs tickling my nostrils at all, heheh. It holds a charge for a very long time & offers enough power to get the job done in a timely mannor. I went 5 days on a single charge while on vacation and honestly only attached it to the charger to be sure it would have full potential for shaving & trimming, not because it was dieing or running out of charge! All the attchments remove and connect easily and can easily be cleaned form hair debris with the offered cleaning brush. I think some purchasers were using water to rinse thier attachments but I opted not to just to add to the longevity of the metal parts. The only attachment that I used that collected the most hair internally was the foil shaver wich is a double attachment (2 pieces) that allows for easier cleaning. If I never used the trimmer ever again I feel I got my moneys worth out of it already. To end this review, Id like to note that I believe some reviewers leaving negative feedback were expecting the results of a $100+ shaver/trimmer. I went into this purchase expecting a $20 trimmmer and feel I got that and more and will continue to keep this in use on a regular basis along with my regular home shaving items (razors/shaving cream, etc)!iew, Id like to note that I believe some reviewers leaving negative feedback were expecting the results of a $100+ shaver/trimmer. I went into this purchase expecting a $20 trimmmer and feel I got that and more and will continue to keep this in use on a regular basis along with my regular home shaving items (razors/shaving cream, etc)!
  23. Everything is as advertised. It works great and has a bunch of different settings for length. Great quality for the price.
  24. I had one like this for over 7 years. the beard trimming attachment broke (not the actual razor), so I thought it was time to get a new one. I bought the exact same model because it has been incredibly durable and the only reason the trimming attachment broke was due to my rough treatment of it. I highly recommend this.
  25. I got this product for my bf cause he travels a lot and recently lost his personal shaver. He liked it. When I told him it wasn't very expensive and asked him how it was? His words were &#34;its really very good for its price. &#34;

  27. Small design makes it easy to manoeuvre especially around the ears. One adjustable guide makes it easy to switch to the size you need. Takes about 10-12 hours to charge for a use of at least 20-30 minutes. I did not check exactly how long it lasts.<br />It is recommended to let the charge drain between usage, not kept plugged in continually.<br />Holds the charge well for now. Great for the price.   29. The trimmer itself works fine. It feels pretty sturdy and seems to run fine. It holds a charge really well, I don't have to charge it very often.<br /><br />The attachments are sort of cheap and you have to be really careful when you are putting them on the razor. On the 'hair comb' attachment, the little black plastic piece that locks in a length broke the 5th time I used it. I called Norelco @ 1-800-243-3050 and they sent me a free replacement, which they noted they would only do once. The other ones do the job, but again, they feel sort of cheap.<br /><br />If you're on a budget, then go ahead and pick this trimmer up, but be really careful with the attachments. But if you have a few extra bucks, I might shop around for a razor that is higher quality and that comes with nicer attachments.
  30. Good value for the money. This thing comes with a slew of attachments, most of which I don't need, but you never know! This unit charges fast and is extremely light and easy to handle. Highly recommended for home use!<br /><br />My last Conair ($14) groomer lasted 10+ years- let's see how this puppy does!
  31. You get what you pay for. The clippers are too small for any serious hair cutting. The razor is only good for detail work like getting a sharp edge on side burns. Would take for ever to actually do your whole face. However, it was worth the price for the nose and ear trimmer. Works great (loud in your ears though).
  32. As long as you dont expect any use out of the shaver this is a great product.
  33. This machine have a lot to offer i just need to get use to to hold it in the right angle to not make mistake is good for the price im happy :)
  34. I purchased this product mainly because I was sold on the versatility. Five different attachments, so no need to buy separate products. But if you are in the market for a multi-use trimmer, I'd look elsewhere. First, I had two separate chargers die on me. The first one died after three weeks. A trip to Radio Shack said that a replacement charger would run $30 or more than the cost of a new one. I returned the product and purchase a new G370 thinking maybe I got a black swan. Guess not, because the second charger just died on me after about 6 months. Charger issues aside, I mainly used the full size trimmer attachment with the adjustable levels and the beard & mustache trimmer. The full size trimmer was good at adjusting my facial hair down to a \\"one\\" or fuller than a five o'clock shadow but just enough to keep it professional. This was about the only thing the unit was good at. I used the beard and mustache trimmer to keep my sideburns neat when I didn't have the two-day growth going. While the G370 did neatly square them off, in my opinion, it didn't trim the hair short enough. I tried to finish off my sideburns then with the razor attachment but also that didn't get things short enough. I did use the nose hair trimmer four or five times and I'd say that the G370 did okay in that area. I never tried to trim my hair with the G370, but it feels flimsy enough where I wouldn't trust it to cut hair evenly or professionally. Also, the unit seems to run best on a full charge (obviously) but would quickly die off in terms of effectiveness after one or two uses. If you are thinking of packing it on a business trip greater than five days (i.e. two/three trimmings) then I'd suggest bringing a charger with you (if it doesn't die). I'd suggest looking at a few product levels up from the G370 and paying extra to get a more quality trimming unit.
  35. Cheap and works VERY well. This is the second one I've had. Extremely happy with it.
  36. This set is all I need. Easy to use and works great. This is a replacement set for the older version of this set...which lasted about seven years of me dropping and using and finally the grooming guard broke. Great set at a great price!

  47. This thing works pretty well for nosehairs and shaving, but be careful if you're cutting your own hair with the clippers!<br />It doesn't come with different size guards, it comes with one adjustable guard... and the guard likes to adjust itself sometimes. You've got to be careful to make sure you're not cutting too much off!<br /><br />I'm in the Navy and have been paying $8 for a haircut at least once a month. This thing has paid for itself several times over for me, but the guard still scares me. I have to be very careful with it. I think the adjustable guard also isn't the standard sizes you find in a hair salon. When I tell them I want a 4 faded to a 2, it looks much longer on the top than when I use a 4 on this adjustable guard. I've found that I need a 5 faded to a 1 to get the look I want.<br /><br />Also, haircuts take a while and a lot of battery power. This thing doesn't run if the battery is dead even when it's plugged in, so you've got to make sure you charge it well! It lasts for two haircuts for me before I have to charge it.<br /><br />In all, you pay for what you get. For $14 (what I paid including free 2 day shipping from Amazon Prime) this was a great buy.

  57. I've been using this shave for over a year and am very pleased with the precision and feel of this trimmer. So much so that I have given up shaving and have just been trimming for i have no more razor burn. Note: I have not used this unit for beard trimming, just other hair. Pros: -- Durable, I have dropped the unit on the hard floor twice and instead of breaking, the unit just disassempled itself, absorbing the impact. Great engineering. -- Looks slick, even though it is plastic, Stays nice and shiny. -- Easy cleaning, just open it up and clean the hair out. -- Great precision. This unit has 9 different cutting lenght when an attachment it on it. I use it for touch ups all over the place. Cons: -- Can't use the shaver with it plugged in. Only on charged battery. -- Made of plastic. Overall I love this trimmer. It looks good and performs even better. Solid trimmer that will be durable and last you some time. A great product to trimming, or use instead of shaving for that rugged look.

  71. This Norelco \\"G370 All-in-1 Grooming System\\" has held up remarkably well with fairly heavy usage over the past three years. I keep a very short beard and mustache (see my \\"Profile\\" picture) so do a trim every two or three days. Since I am also getting older, there is now a lot more hair where there aught not to be hair (ears, nose, eyebrows, etc) and fortunately this set has attachments to handle all of those needs.<br /><br />The set comes with the handy caddy tray that holds the attachments and the charger cord can be connected through the bottom so the trimmer recharges when it is seated. The trimmer can easily run through three or four of my sessions without needing to be recharged, which is great when traveling since it is often not necessary to bring my whole kit along.<br /><br />My only real issue with the trimmer is that with the spacer attached the hair gets crammed down in between the attachment and trimmer body, making it messy to clean out.<br /><br />Highly Recommended!<br /><br />CFH

  80. The basic cutter design works well, however, the plastic trimmer parts are just impossible. When you try to adjust the trimmer to a higher setting the entire trimmer head snaps off. In the other direction the trimmer reverts to the 1 setting with no apparent action on my part. This AM I cut my beard short for the second time because of this reversion to the 1 setting. I don't believe I should have to check the setting each time I use the trimmer, and yes, I do know how this thing is meant to operate. Second issue, the charging instructions are written for a Ni-Cad battery and manual says the non-replaceable battery is a LiIon type. So, does the charger match the battery? I know this is a bottom end trimmer but I believe the manual should make sense and the unit should function as desired. Don't buy this thing, I now am in the market for a real trimmer.

  83. Over the years when one of these has finally gotten too dull to cut my husband's hair I will buy another of the same. They are a very good price and save us a lot of money on his hair cutting costs. I am no hair cutter, but since he likes his one short length all over it's as simple as can be. I use one attachment to cut and another to trim around the ears and back of the neck. I will do this every 4 - 6 weeks. When I finish with a hair cut, I leave the cutting attachment in and run it until the battery has died completely. That way when it recharges I will have a full running charge to work with. I think it says it takes 10 hours to recharge and I just do that overnight and unplug and store away until it's needed again. Hope this helps another who may consider buying this product.

  87. This grooming system is versatile and does not take up much space on the counter. Yes, the build quality could be better, and the way that the parts combine and re-combine is somewhat confusing, but at around $20 (with free shipping if combined with another purchase), you can't go wrong.<br /><br />I have been using this system intermittently for a couple of months now. While I would not substitute it for my regular razor, it is great for quick touch-ups, thinning, and definition. So far, the battery is strong and seems to hold its charge for a long time.<br /><br />For best results, take the time with scissors to carefully open the clamshell package, give the directions at least a quick read-thru, and study how the system works. It's pretty ingenious, really.<br /><br />The instructions are available online as a PDF. Reading this PDF will help you decide whether this purchase is for you. Here is a currently working link:<br /><br />[...]<br /><br />Otherwise, you can search by product name (\\"Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System\\").<br /><br />--Bill Brent [20 July 2010]

  103. For less than $16 this little guy can't be beat. I've used this for several years to trim my facial hair, sideburns, and nose hairs with zero problems. Pros: Fully adjustable guard lets you trim down really close or go long if you want. Rechargeable battery charges pretty quick and holds a charge for a while. Comes with adapters for hair, sideburns, and nose hairs. Comes with a little stand to keep everything organized. Comes with a little brush to clean it out after every use. Cons: Not waterproof (can't expect too much for the cost). You can't run the unit with it plugged into the AC adapter (plan ahead and make sure it's charged before you need it). Sometimes it's easy to accidentally move the guard length and trim too short (check the number before each use!) Tips: Honestly the only maintenance I ever did while using this was to take off the black adapter and the guard that attached to it and rinse both of those out under running water. I would dry them off and let them sit on a towel. Occasionally I would brush out the attachment, but rarely every found the need to. Overall I give this 5 stars for its low price and easy of use. Also when you are using the guard make sure that you have it on the right number EACH TIME YOU USE IT. I can't stress enough how many times I've accidentally trimmed too short because it's sometimes easy to accidentally adjust the guard length and instead of trimming with it on 2 or 3 I accidentally had it on 1.
  104. Insanely versatile for the price. I've been using this bad boy for well over a year now and it's still going. I use it to trim my beard, nose hair, private areas, and I used to use it for my head.<br /><br />This is cheap, there's no denying that. However, if you want something that can cut hair in a large variety of ways, this thing can do it all. If you trim your beard regularly, and buzz your head often, I'd get separate devices for those.<br /><br />My main issues with this device have to do with battery and power. The battery is weak and the charger isn't powerful enough to just plug this in while you use it. The power also makes it difficult to shave my head effectively. Also, there's no indicator for how much battery life this thing has.<br /><br />This thing works. It can do it all, just not incredibly well.

  141. So I read quite a few reviews for this and a couple of other beard trimmers out there before deciding on this one. The item that tipped the scales in favor of this model was the mini razor attachment that is included. I was hoping that I might be able to replace my full size razor and just use that for trimming around my neck and face while sporting a beard. The item arrived only 2 days after ordering (and I used the \\"slower\\" free shipping method) exactly as described. Well, it arrived exactly as the photo supplied by Michael indicates. As at least one review pointed out the nice stand that is shown IS NOT included. I knew that in advance so it wasn't a problem for me. I cut it out of its packaging and charged it for a good twelve hours before its first use. I'm writing this review after only using it for about a week but here's what I've found so far. The trimmer is great! I've tried all of the attachments and found that they all work as I would hope. The mini razor does an excellent job and is VERY useful for trimming around my mouth and spots that my full size razor makes a bit difficult. It won't be replacing the full size though. Takes a bit too long to shave my neck with such a small razor, but I think I'll probably still find use for the mini razor even after I shave my beard. I've used the trimmer in some capacity nearly every day in the last week and the battery is still going strong from its first charge. I think it will work quite well as long as you follow the instructions that came with it. Overall a great product for a fantastic price! We'll see how it holds up over time but for fifteen bucks if it runs for more than a year I'll be satisfied. If I find any major changes in the performance of the device I'll pop back and add to this review. Otherwise you may assume I'm a very satisfied customer!

  152. I've owned this trimmer for about 3-4 years. I just bought it at a local retail store because I wanted something ASAP under $40. I was replacing an older version of the [[ASIN:B00005MA7P Conair 3-in-1 Personal Trimmer]].<br /><br />Pros<br />-Cheap.<br />-Nose hair trimmer works the best of all the attachments...as long as you adjust to the feeling of it pulling out your nose hairs since the rotating blade is plastic and dull.<br /><br />Cons<br />-You get what you pay for.<br />-The trimmer blades pinch your skin unless you actively focus on keeping them off of your skin or use the adjustable height attachment.<br />-Short battery life due to Ni-Cd battery. It also must be fully drained before charging so it doesn't form a \\"memory.\\"<br />-Attachments fall off even without pushing the release button. You have to hold them on as you shave.<br />-Adjustable height attachment will slip if any pressure is applied whatsoever. (I first learned this when trying to buzz my own hair...went from a 6 or 7 all the way to a 1. Needless to say after taking a huge chunk of hair I had to keep it at 1 to even it out.)<br />-The rotating mechanism and the receiving end of the attachments are all plastic.<br /><br />My recommendation is to save your money for one of the better trimmers in the $30-$50 range since my experience with this trimmer as well the [[ASIN:B00005MA7P Conair 3-in-1 Personal Trimmer]] has been disappointing. Though I will say of the entry level trimmers the Conair was far superior when just using the default attachment since its blades had much tighter spacing; this made it less likely to pinch your skin.

  163. I decided to buy this kit after reading several reviews. I was very impressed with the overall quality of the trimmer and attachments. It seems that Norelco has mastered the art of combining high quality stainless steel with durable, precision-molded and assembled plastics. It is unbelievable that such a combination of grooming devices can be packaged all for less than $20! The basic machine is a simple rotating \\"finger\\" that results in reciprocating action by the several trimmers and shavers in the kit. It is comfortable in the hand, quiet and balanced.<br /><br />I have used the basic trimmer, the nose/ear trimmer, and the beard trimmer successfully. The tiny shaver is a bit of a puzzle due to its small size, but it does what it is suppose to, which is allows close shaving along the edges of a trimmed beard.<br /><br />I am looking forward to using the hair grooming device, as I usually have my barber cut my hair to 1/2 inch length. I should be able to use the Norelco to do that. Once you master the settings for the combs for beard and hair trimming, it is not difficult to keep the setting stable.<br /><br />Always read the directions to understand battery charging and extending the battery life. I have a 10-year-old Norelco Reflex Plus cordless shaver with new cutters, and the battery still holds a charge for weeks.

  215. I still own a Norelco 20XL, but because the NiCad battery would no longer take a charge I decided to try the G370. Well, let me tell you, don't waste your money on this piece of junk! (Sorry Norelco!) To begin, using the beard/hair trimmer attachment is a joke. Trying to adjust it will cause the head assembly to come off because the mechanism that locks the adjustment in place is poorly designed. Also, compared to the 20XL, the G370 looks and feels like it's flimsily made--actually because it is! It appears Norelco set out to design something like the 20XL but provides more options while keeping the price down at where the 20XL sold for. The only thing I found going for the G370 is that Norelco is now using a NiMH battery instead of a NiCad battery. Why do I know this? Because I took the G370 apart and took its battery out and replaced the NiCad battery in my 20XL. Now I have my 20XL working and I threw away the piece of junk G370. By the way, you can use a NiMH battery in a device that is designed for a NiCad battery. However, always read manufacturer's warning label just in case. Just be aware that charging time will vary between a NiMH and NiCad.
  216. People who expect a $100 trimmer who buy this one and are disappointed by it, are crazy! This cost me $14 and works great. I trim up my beard twice a week and it works without a problem. I haven't had issues with the plastic attachments breaking and even if something would break, it cost me $14 so I would get over it. If this trimmer last me only a year, I wouldn't be sad because it had served its purpose. Great trimmer for the guy who doesn't need it everyday. Don't look any further.
  217. I have had a number of poorly constructed or faulty trimmers in a row. This one lives up to the good reviews, at a very reasonable price none the less. Everytime I use it I end up drawing blood somewhere. It's just cheap... and painful. You can't use it if it is plugged in, which is useless if the battery dies, and it takes a full day to charge.   220. It took some time for me to write this review simply because I needed ample time to use this product and all its components. After doing such, I must say I am completely satisfied with my purchase. The blades are sharp and cleaning is a breeze (just rinse with running water). It's cordless, rechargeable, has a storage pouch and doesn't make that much noise (in my opinion). I'll break things down as it relates to each piece of the clipper set.<br /><br />1) The Full-size Trimmer: Awesome, ergonomic design, lightweight, effective. Does an even job QUICKLY!<br /><br />2) Mini shaver: I really didn't have use for this piece actually... nothing came out of it for me but maybe it did for others<br /><br />3) Hair clipper: I have very short hair (close enough to my scalp) so suffice to say this didn't do much for me. It didn't go low enough to properly cut my hair and the grooves in the teeth left uneven spaces, which eventually led me to use the full-size trimmer on its own. What I do love about it though is that I can adjust the height of the cap from 1-9.<br /><br />4) Beard & moustache trimmer: This is great! It delivers! I got an even cut and I could also adjust the height of the cap from 1-9 similar to the hair clipper. When the hair clipper didn't get to my hair I immediately switched to this cap and got great results in a short time.<br /><br />5) Nose, ear & eyebrow trimmer: I only used this on my nose (I don't have ear hair and I don't have a need to trim my eyebrows) and it worked great. Tickled at first but it did an awesome job.<br /><br />6) Precision & detailing trimmer: As the name suggests, it delivers precise action each and every time.<br /><br />Overall I am happy I found this item and I'd recommend it to anyone. One thing I forgot to mention is that I wish it came with the stand that's displayed in one of the product pictures, but it's not so much a big deal to me since I still store every piece in the original hard plastic package.

  240. This is my first beard trimmer purchase. Until now I've been using grooming scissors to trim my goatee. This trimmer is excellent! Very easy to use, the attachments snap on pretty easily. Other trimmer reviews complained that the attachments were flimsy and that the snaps would chip or break off after about 3-4 uses, except for the hair comb attachment this trimmer's attachments don't feel very flimsy. The blade attachments snap in easily, and then the comb attachments click in place over the blade. It's fairly simple, and works well. Almost as soon as the trimmer arrived I had it out of the box and was trimming my goatee. It performed excellently, and only took about 2-3 minutes to get set up, trimming, and done. I was rinsing out the attachment and letting it dry before I knew it. I've used all the attachments except for the nose/ear/brow trimmer and can say I'm happy with this purchase. You probably can't find a better trimmer setup for the price.
  241. This shaver was actually a replacement for an identical one that also failed after a few months.   242. The precision trimmer and the full size trimmer (with comb) work fantastically. I imagine the clippers (being based on the full-size trimmer) will work well too. I found the mini-shaver useless (takes forever to shave anything), and have not tried the nose-hair trimmer yet. Also, the bag is very cheap and I threw it out because it was coming apart. Despite the low quality of some of the other accessories, the core functionality is great, especially for the price, so I'll only take one star off for that. I bought for growing my first beard and didn't want to spend a lot of money on a trimmer. So far I've no regrets or desire to upgrade to anything else. I'd recommend this to anyone who doesn't have a trimmer already.

  245. Cheaply made, hard to clean, and easily broken. The beard trimmer attachment is very delicate, the nose hair trimmer is pretty dull, and the foil shaver does absolutely nothing. NOTHING. How happy you are with your purchase depends on what you pay for it, and the price here seems to fluctuate wildly. I paid twenty dollars in 2011; now they're asking more than fifty.   246. The grooming system is good for maintaining a beard. The small shaver is good for removing growth in the parts of the face that you do not want bearded. The trimming system (a small and a large trimmer) are good for trimming beard edges. The large trimmer has a calibrated comb that allows you to trim the hair on the top of the head. That is good for cutting down the number of haircuts that you need. With another setting you can also trim the beard (I wear a fairly short facial beard) The nose and ear hair trimmer works, but not perfectly. It is noisy when you trim in the ears - I was nervous whether there was the potential of damaging hearing. It also requires many passes to get at all the hairs. I use the small trimmer initially to remove long hears and then I follow up with the nose and ear trimmer. The charger is not a hi-tech charger. It only works on US voltages, and there is no protection for the NiCad batteries
  247. I use this to trim lighter areas of my fluffy cat. It works well without having to get out the big clipper. Haven't used it on a human yet though.

  260. Let me first say, overall I am pleased with the performance of this trimmer. It met all of my expectations as an inexpensive facial hair trimmer and lasted about as long as you might suspect, in my case a little over a year. If you're looking for a high quality device that will stand the test of time, look elsewhere. But for under $20 this thing is a hell of a lot cheaper and more convenient than a years supply of razors (assuming you don't mind the 5-o-clock shadow look) or even a single trip to a professional. Other than durability, which is not great by the way, one minor complaint I do have about the design is that it is very easy to press the button that detaches any given shaving/trimming piece for the device while you are in the middle of using it. On more than one occasion, I would accidentally tap the release button and send the beard trimmer flying across the floor of my bathroom. After a year or so of use mine doesn't even turn on anymore, but some will probably have better luck. For me, it's time to shop around for something different.

  265. I received the item as a gift, and I didn't already have a trimmer, so I decided to open the package and use it despite the myriad negative reviews. I have an average beard - not too thick, not too thin, but full face coverage. I keep it trimmed under 1 inch almost all the time, and usually much shorter. Packaging: The package is a blister pack which encloses the trimmer, attachments, carrying case, the base stand/holder, and a charging adapter. The charging adapter can be attached to the base stand, although it's a pretty cheesy design. The packaging is attractive and protective in PET recyclable plastic, and all the necessary operating parts are included. Design: The base stand/holder is thin plastic, cheaply made, and barely functional. The attachments are likewise cheap, poorly made plastic with barely functional adjusting mechanism. The trimmer unit has a fixed internal battery which is charged by plugging in a 1.6 volt, 80 mA power supply with positive tip - a small yellow one that is the same size often used to charge mobile phones and bluetooth devices. Previous reviewers are correct in saying that the trimmer cannot be powered directly from a wall outlet. The user can leave it plugged in during operation, but it will not draw wall power in any way (the LED indicator shuts off) when the trimmer switch is on. The trimmer unit seems thus far to be solidly built. Function: I gave the item 2 stars because it works for trimming facial hair, but not very well. It cuts slowly and awkwardly even through hair on accessible areas of the face and neck. Attachments are adjustable for various hair lengths, but the user soon discovers that the attachment and adjustment mechanisms are inexact and flimsy. The trimming process is not a pleasant experience, and the poor design and cheap construction are the reasons why. In my first attempt, the trimming attachment went careening into the nearby toilet. If I keep the item, I anticipate having the experience ofholding the attachments on the trimmer, as previous reviews have commented. The manufacturer provides a 45-day money back guarantee if the product is postmarked within the time period and mailed along with the store receipt. Call 800.243.3050 for authorization. Defective products will be repaired or replaced without charge for a period of two years from date of purchase. In summary: Flimsy. Barely functional. Not worth $20, but possibly worth $5-$10. Do not expect this to be a lifelong friend, but it should work for a short period of time or in a pinch. Other brands I have used, including Wahl and even Conair, have worked much better. This should not be considered an indictment of all Philips Norelco products, as I have been satisfied with others. In this case, however, consider paying more for a better product.
  266. It works ok, however it is not particularly sharp. Don't expect to have very smooth edges. However it cuts fine and fits well in the hand. The charge life is average, and the whole thing looks and feels sturdy and well built.
  267. If you are planning to use this as a hair trimmer for kids then it is not the one. The switch that adjusts the length of cut attachment is too flimsy. Numerous time the whole trim head slides off since the plastic adjustor on top sits too tight on the hair trimmer. Happened 3-4 times while I was trimming my sons hair. ( I do that between his visits to the hair cuttery). Finally I called Norelco and invoked the 45 day money back gurantee and sent it back.
  268. This is relevant for G370/G380: I purchased the trimmer as I liked the convenience of a cord free appliance. I travel a lot, so it's great to be able to pack and take with me. It's very convenient, works really well - I use for trimming hair only. Major downside is the flimsy adjustable hair trimmer. The adjustments are not very secure when fitted to the trimmer, however, the flimsy plastic teeth on the comb easily break. I've contacted Philips/Norelco and it's not possible to buy replacement hair trimmer attachments, they can't even ship you one for free. As the item is sold with a Two Year Warranty in the US they will replace the full product for you. Seems like such a waste of money in return shipping, packagaing etc. Come on Philips, just come out with a sturdier hair trimmer attachment that you provide an appropriate hard case for that can easily be used whilst travelling.

I also like that it came with a plug in charger, because it's a pain to have to buy batteries all the time. This is a very good product.

  290. Had my first one for a number of years (until I dropped it and flushed it down the toilet on accident). Found the exact same model so had to get it. Great product (many more attachments than I hope to ever need to use - seriously, who uses a nose hair trimmer?).
  291. I bought this product almost 4 years ago and its still kicking! Trimmer still cuts facial hair with no tugging or pulling and I have some thick facial hair. I was skeptical at first being so cheap with all those attachments, but was pleasantly surprised. The adjustable beard trimmer is just great, no more switching on and off different clips. I really only use this to trim my beard and use the other attachment for my sideburns. Battery charge holds pretty well, I use this about 1-2 times a week and cant remember when I charged it last. It did give me some trouble recharging it before (about 2 years after purchase), the recharge light didn't come on when I plugged it in, thought it was busted. But I fooled with it a bit more and it works again. Even if it died at the time, there is no question in my mind whether or not I'd buy another. Whenever it finally decides to kick the bucket, I'll place another order.
  292. I have one of these, and bought this one for my friend. I have been using this for more than three years now, still working great. Replaced the the internal-battery once, about a year back.
  293. I bought this a while back and began finding problems with it right away. <br /> <br />1) The trimmer cannot operate on A/C power alone. This means you can't plug it into the wall and use it. Instead, you have to charge the battery, then unplug it to use it. <br /> <br />2) About 2 weeks after I bought it, the beard trimmer attachment broke. The little tabs that hold it at different lengths snapped off so you can only use it on the shortest setting, and you have to hold the attachment on with your hand so it won't slide off. Clearly, I'm not the only one who this has happened to. <br /> <br />3) The nose trimmer has very dull blades. I don't normally use a nose trimmer nor do I really need one, but I have a cheap one that I got in my Christmas stocking that I've used a few times. Out of curiosity, I tried the attachment that came with this trimmer and was introduced to a new kind of pain. It was pulling at the hairs but not cutting them. <br /> <br />I contacted the a representative at Norelco to see if I they would send me a replacement beard attachment or if I could purchase just that attachment. They directed me to their service centers who wanted $10 for just that attachment. Including shipping, it would have cost me almost what I payed for the whole set. <br /> <br />My advice: pay a little more for something sturdier. That's what I plan on doing.

  297. I have been using this watch for over 2 years. Here are my views about this product:<br /><br />Positive:<br />• Works good, never had any issues in last two years<br />• You can use it at least two times, approx. 30 mins after one charge of abt 6-8 hours<br />• Pretty affordable and reliable<br />• Precision blade and attachments are nice for sideburns<br /><br />Negative:<br />• So many fancy attachments, half of them are just useless.<br />• Even at biggest level, if you try to trim the hairs of your head, it will chop them too short.<br />• Will leave a pretty subtle and thick beard. Not close enough for a trimmer at lowest level.<br />• Shaver attachment is a piece of junk. If you try to use it, it will take you almost an hour to complete your shave with uniformity and as soon as you will start shaving, you will realize its not efficient but since you started, you will have to finish it :p<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />If you want subtle thick beard, this is right and one of the most affordable product. Quite reliable too but if you like close to 1-2 day earlier shaved like beard, look for something else.<br />With other trimmers, I used to do trimming once in a week but since this one leaves a thick beard (but it is pretty uniform) so I have to use it twice a week.<br /><br />PS: If this review was helpful to you in any way, pleas vote “Yes/helpful”
  298. My husband had an old beard/mustache/nose hair trimmer. Took batteries so they would lose their juice. This trimmer plugs-in for the charge, but is cordless for the trim. It comes with multiple attachments and the Norelco brandname to back it up. My husband is quite happy with this item.
  299. got this for my boyfriend for christmas (2012) its still working (christmas 2013) and he LOVES it!! He has a beard but likes to keep the edges and sides neat and tidy, it does the job very well!
  300. I owed some similar - or earlier - model of this trimmer, purchased at BB&B long time ago. Eventually all of its attachments, made of clear and exceptionally brittle plastic, shattered - some due to falls, some simply from normal use; in fact, using the trimmer at the shortest setting made them crack and break at the point of contact with shaver blades.<br /><br />Despite that, and some reviews for this model pointing to the same flaw, I decided to buy it and be more careful with the grooming attachments. The old trimmer itself still works - the motor, battery (per its manual, I never left it permanently plugged in) and the blades on it were still just fine. The attachments system on this one is completely different and generally improved, though the material is just as fragile, so don't let them fall or hit anything. It generally does a very good, accurate and fast job trimming by beard. My only new complaint is in the mechanism that connects the motor drive shaft to the blades - it is covered by white solid grease, some hairs do get inside, and eventually get stuck in that grease. Removing them without removing the grease is obviously not easy.
  301. This is the 2nd set I owned, the first I broke the attachements. The trimmer set is a very decent trimmer, with nice attachments and a good powerfull motor. I use it regularly to trim down my facial hair. The charge lasts pretty long, but dont go overboard and try to cut alot of hair on your head, since it might drain before you finish (30 minutes non stop use on longer hairs). But in general this hair trimmer is well made and worth the price.

  305. I got this awhile ago to replace another sub-par product I had. I don't have a full beard or mustache; I just try and keep a very neat, short goatee, and some stubble, and also prefer the option to \\"clean it up\\" once in awhile. This product does not allow for this at all. The default blades do not cut close enough to the skin, whereas the shaver pulls hairs instead of shaving them. There's no way to get a clean line across with any of the attachments, something that my older entry level Remington could do (I only replaced it because the attachment broke, but that's a different story). Bottom line is I wouldn't recommend this product. I'd spend a little more on one that had a sharp trimmer that produced sharp, clean edges.

  310. I find that most things that are multi-purpose are never as good as a product that is meant for one thing. Case in point, this is a good hair trimmer. That being said, it is iniexpensive and works GREAT as a hair trimmer (face pre shave, body, sideburns, etc) and is completely worth buying for that purpose.

  316. If, like me, you are in the market for a $15 grooming device, then let's just be honest: neither of us really cares that much about what we get. We just want something that will put our facial hair in the \\"acceptable\\" range. Somewhere between Justin Bieber and Ted Kacyzinski.<br /><br />This little guy is enough for me. If you have a goatee or a modest beard, it's probably enough for you, too. It's exactly as cheap as you'd imagine it to be. Got the painted plastic grey buttons and some fairly dinky attachments. But it has nine stop settings on it, comes with a charger, and is powerful enough that it won't pinch the hairs out of your face.<br /><br />You don't buy this razor to impress anyone, or to accumulate self-respect. You buy this razor because you'd rather save your money for the dates you'll be getting because your face is now *attractive enough* for the opposite sex.<br /><br />Godspeed, fellow tightwad.
  317. Worked quite well until it stopped working about a year after I bought it. I'm not crazy about any device that lasts only a bit over a year with maybe use once per week.
  318. I purchased this product from Target and returned it after one use. Here was the problem:<br /><br />The \\"lock-in\\" length settings were easy enough to change, but they did not actually lock in. When I tried to trim my beard at a 6, the very first time I pressed it to my face, the length setting collapsed all the way down to a 1, effectively shaving off my beard. I had to shave off my entire beard and start from scratch.<br /><br />Massively terrible design flaw there, and I highly recommend you do not purchase this product.

  321. I purchased this groomer almost a year ago. My first impression was that the housing seemed fragile and the motor underpowered. After regular use, I have changed my mind.<br /><br />The razors remain sharp. The power is more than sufficient. A single recharge lasts for weeks. The groomer is easy to pack, and it is well-designed for the hand. This is a solid, efficient, reliable instrument, and I am very pleased with the purchase.<br /><br />The only caveat: If your beard is especially coarse or heavy, you may not be as satisfied as I have been.

  325. Decided to look for a new beard and mustache trimmer when my trusty old Norelco Maverick TX-450 finally gave up the ghost and just quit running. If this sounds like I'm slamming the product, I'm not, as I had owned this basic battery-operated trimmer for over sixteen years - far longer than I ever expected it to last when I first got it. I could have probably fixed it (again) if I disassembled and cleaned it out, but decided to see what might be new on the market. This was primarily used as a mustache trimmer, but after using it for a few years with a handheld comb, was able to do a fair job with my beard.<br /><br />Was amazed to see how many models were now available, and how many companies were making them. After doing some research (and asking my barber), ended up getting the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]], and must say that so far this seems to have been a good choice. My barber had suggested that I stay with the more basic (and more economical) trimmers, as most from a particular manufacturer have the same heads as their higher-priced models, and it was the cutting head itself that made a trimmer good or bad. He had suggested that I consider some of the Wahl and Panasonic models, but also had a personal preference for the Philips Norelco products, as they seemed to last... which I had also experienced.<br /><br />This trimmer has a great array of attachments, and each of them is quite useful, performing exactly as expected. It has an excellent beard and moustache comb/guide with nine locking length settings, as does the hair clipper comb. The little mini-shaver attachment is good for cleanup, and acts like a miniature micro-screen electric razor. Was cautious about the nose and ear trimmer, but after reading the instruction sheet, found that it was easy to master.<br /><br />This model features:<br /><br />* Six attachments that can be rinsed, making it easy to clean<br />* Nine length settings with the key trimming attachments<br />* Self-sharpening blades, no oil needed<br />* Small travel pouch<br />* Two-year factory warranty<br /><br />Took the time to read the instruction sheet that came with this trimmer, which was detailed but easy to understand. The instructions had indicated that the trimmer shouldn't be left with the unit charging full-time, which I found to be a nuisance at first. Charged it for the ten hours suggested before using it, and it worked fine, and a charge lasts for weeks. The charging/attachment stand itself looked to be a bit flimsy at first glance, but while handling it when I was setting it up, found that it was sturdier than I had first thought.<br /><br />Please Note: According to the latest info, this small charging stand no longer comes with the G370 as it did when I first reviewed it in 2009. It no longer appears on the Philips Norelco site as an option, either. Mine was made in China, which made me skeptical at first, but my initial doubts were eased over time, as it has proven to be an excellent trimmer over the long run. I do not know where the current versions are made, but go by the product description if it matters to you.<br /><br />This unit, as so many products today, came in one of those irritating theft-deterrent clamshell packages designed for retail stores. This one was more of a nuisance to open than most because it was difficult to see if the contents were going to be damaged when cutting through the plastic with a combination of scissors and a sharp knife. Just be careful when opening it.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Excellent selection of attachments<br />- Green light on power unit indicates charging<br />- A single charge lasts for weeks<br />- Good ergonomics, nice feel to it<br />- Solid; seems to be built well<br />- Detailed instruction sheet<br />- 60-day money-back guarantee, 2-year warranty<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Horrible clamshell package, difficult to open<br /><br />Since we all have different things that we look for in trimmerslike this, thought that I might share some of my findings with others here.<br /><br />Also considered the [[ASIN:B000FED5DK Philips Norelco G380 All-in-1 Grooming System]], but the only difference between this and the Philips Norelco G370 Trimmer was that the G380 came in a gray color and had a travel pouch... which also came with the black G370 trimmer.<br /><br />Looked at the [[ASIN:B000FEF1V4 Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer]] which was considered for its hair deflector and vacuum, but the price difference was enough to make me go for the more basic G370 trimmer.<br /><br />The [[ASIN:B00009RF1E Wahl 9918-617 Groomsman Beard and Mustache Trimmer]] seemed to be a good one, and its ability to operate cordless via battery or plugged into charger sounded good, and it had good reviews. This was a very close second choice.<br /><br />The [[ASIN:B000GP5752 Wahl 9877-500 \\"The Goatee\\" Advanced Dual Blade, Rechargeable/Cordless Beard, Goatee & Mustache Trimmer]] had some interesting dual blades, but the Philips Norelco G370 had more attachments, and the model that I looked at made me shy away from this one.<br /><br />Had also considered the stylish [[ASIN:B000VKV29M Panasonic ER2403K 5 Position Beard/Moustache Trimmer]]. This one features wet or dry trimming, five length adjustments and an excellent price, but since it uses two AAA batteries, decided to rule it out.<br /><br />In the end, it was my past experience with the Philips Norelco products that helped make my choice, and I don't regret it. If I can get even a fourth of the life of the sixteen years of service that I got from my original Maverick TX-450, then I'll be happy.<br /><br />Updated January 10, 2012:<br /><br />Have been using this Philips Norelco G370 trimmer for almost three years since this review was posted on January 24, 2009. Actually wondered how long it would really last when I originally posted it, with most of the concerns being (1) the life of the rechargeable battery, and (2) the sharpness of the blades on the attachments. Had shaved my beard off in 2010, so it became a daily moustache trimmer. Then I grew the beard again a little over a year ago, and it has seen daily use once again. Happy to report that the trimming attachments are still sharp, and the rechargeable battery is still going strong. This has turned out to be one of the best bargains that I've bought here... period.<br /><br />Updated May 2, 2012:<br /><br />One reader commented that the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] no longer comes with a charging stand with storage slots, as my review had originally noted. The online comparison chart between the various Philips Norelco trimmers doesn't seem to exist here on Amazon... at least I cannot locate the one that had this model. Please understand that my review was originally written and posted on January 24th, 2009, and reflected my opinion of the product when I purchased it at that time. Manufacturers do change options from time to time, and as a reviewer it irritates me, but it does happen. Some time ago I quit using the stand and opted instead for using the travel pouch as my lifestyle has become more mobile over the last two years. In any case, the charge was running low yesterday, I plugged it in and this morning was able to use this morning. I brushed out the trimmer heads, rinsed them under running water, shook them dry and trim my beard as I've been doing all along.<br /><br />Updated 3/1/2013:<br /><br />Earlier this year I pocked up the [[ASIN:B00ARF44O6 Philips Norelco QT4014/42 Beard and Stubble Trimmer]], more of an evolutionary upgrade than anything. Experience with a particular brand can be the best teacher when looking at a product, and my good results with the more basic Philips Norelco G370 here that I had purchased it in 2008 made it a good choice. My G370 is still functional and operating quite well, though it's battery life is on a slight decline after five years of use, so I have no complaints. The newer Philips Norelco QT4014/42 trimmer offers a number of convenience features, such as 20 length settings, one-hour charge time, the ability to use cordless or while charging, and more. Though more costly, it's an excellent alternative for those who want more in a beard trimmer, and highly recommended.<br /><br />Note:<br /><br />I'll still stand behind my 5-star recommendation, especially considering the price on the G370. And I'll continue to reply to comments left here, as I've done along.arpness of the blades on the attachments. Had shaved my beard off in 2010, so it became a daily moustache trimmer. Then I grew the beard again a little over a year ago, and it has seen daily use once again. Happy to report that the trimming attachments are still sharp, and the rechargeable battery is still going strong. This has turned out to be one of the best bargains that I've bought here... period.<br /><br />Updated May 2, 2012:<br /><br />One reader commented that the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] no longer comes with a charging stand with storage slots, as my review had originally noted. The online comparison chart between the various Philips Norelco trimmers doesn't seem to exist here on Amazon... at least I cannot locate the one that had this model. Please understand that my review was originally written and posted on January 24th, 2009, and reflected my opinion of the product when I purchased it at that time. Manufacturers do change options from time to time, and as a reviewer it irritates me, but it does happen. Some time ago I quit using the stand and opted instead for using the travel pouch as my lifestyle has become more mobile over the last two years. In any case, the charge was running low yesterday, I plugged it in and this morning was able to use this morning. I brushed out the trimmer heads, rinsed them under running water, shook them dry and trim my beard as I've been doing all along.<br /><br />Updated 3/1/2013:<br /><br />Earlier this year I pocked up the [[ASIN:B00ARF44O6 Philips Norelco QT4014/42 Beard and Stubble Trimmer]], more of an evolutionary upgrade than anything. Experience with a particular brand can be the best teacher when looking at a product, and my good results with the more basic Philips Norelco G370 here that I had purchased it in 2008 made it a good choice. My G370 is still functional and operating quite well, though it's battery life is on a slight decline after five years of use, so I have no complaints. The newer Philips Norelco QT4014/42 trimmer offers a number of convenience features, such as 20 length settings, one-hour charge time, the ability to use cordless or while charging, and more. Though more costly, it's an excellent alternative for those who want more in a beard trimmer, and highly recommended.<br /><br />Note:<br /><br />I'll still stand behind my 5-star recommendation, especially considering the price on the G370.   332. I've had a older Norelco beard trimmer for years, and was very pleased with it. I was afraid that because of its age, it might fail on me at a bad time, so when I saw this one which looked very similar, I bought it. Turns out it is identical except for color (the old one is light gray) and the parts will interchange. So now I have a brand new one just like the one I've used and liked for years, plus a bunch of interchangeable spare parts and an spare charger. My only complaint with the new one is the color. After one use, I see why they made their earlier model light gray. The new black one attracts beard trimmings and looks awful after just a short use, especially if your beard is gray. Never even noticed it on the gray one. The new black one is much better looking than the old one, but only for a few moments until you use it.

I do not use it to trim other body hair, and would not suggest it as a tool for maintaining large areas or large amounts of hair.   361. First of all, the price listed on this item is around $37, which is way more than what I paid. I think it was close to $20 when I bought it. Price aside, I have owned the product for a few years now, so I figure I can write the pros and cons of the product.<br /><br />+ I like the carrying case and the number of attachments it comes with<br />+ It seems to hold a decent charge. I have never run out of power mid trim (even after moderate use for about 2 years)<br />+ It comes with a nice plastic base to store the unit and all the attachments when not in use<br /><br />- The nose hair trimmer isn't the best. It doesn't seem to be sharp enough to do a great job<br />- The beard trimmer attachment only has 9 settings. While that seems great, it really isn't. I don't have a beard, I have the shorter \\"sexy stubble\\". The #2 setting seems to be too long, but when I switch to setting #1 it looks way too short. Yes I am picky, but I want a setting in between. The ONLY reason I am shopping for a new grooming system now is because of this point.<br />- There is no \\"low battery\\" light on the unit, so you should get into the routine of charging it after every 3-4 uses so it doesn't die.

I've returned this product and purchased another Remington, the adjustment for length is still the same as it was on my old trimmer, a great design why change it.   382. I have had a shaved head for years, and also seem to sport the \\"5 o'clock shadow look on my face. I didn't think it'd have enough power to cut through the thicker hair on my head, but does so with ease. Very light and very maneuverable. A small stand that would hold the trimmer and attachments would be great. All in all, its been life changing for me! A huge improvement over my corded, heavy and out dated wahls.

The foil trimmer is nearly as good as the Definer. The \\"clipper\\" trimmer is much larger than the Definer and not nearly as accurate for trimming the bottom of my mustache, but very adequate. The nose trimmer works very well. I haven't had a chance to use the different attachments for trimming my beard length yet (beard is too new), but based on my experience with the rest of the trimmer I am guessing it will work well. One real plus is that I only got three or four months use out of the Definer foil. I have used this trimmer every day for nearly seven months and am on the original foil. My guess is that when this foil wears out I'll have to buy a new trimmer, as a new foil will probably cost almost as much... if one is available.<br /><br />As I mentioned above, the Norelco Definer is the best small trimmer I have ever used. I would love to buy about a dozen to last me the rest of my life. Short of that, this trimmer works well and is much less expensive than the Definer. The quality is \\"good enough\\" although not to the level of the Definer, but the trimmer does everything it's suppose to do at a very affordable price.

  415. I've always meant to pick up a clipper. My first purchase was a cheap Wahl that - while effective - was loud, was a bit awkward to manage with the power cord, and failed after a few uses. When shopping for a replacement, I opted for the more familiar Norelco name and the G370. It's small, quiet, and works just great. It's a bit smaller than expected and requires several passes for an even trim. It's designed to run purely off the rechargeable battery, so plan on letting it charge for 10 hours before initial use or after the battery runs out. It runs for about 30-40 minutes before requiring recharging. I can't say the instruction booklet was very clear, and it takes a bit of poking around to figure out how things interlock with the accessories; however, it's not rocket science and it is designed rather cleverly. Whether you're saving money on haircuts or pretending you have cancer, this is certainly worth the price.
  416. I have a similar beard trimmer to this that I picked up at Bed Bath & Beyond for $45. I loved the trimmer so much I picked this one up for my vacation house. Its not a big deal because its only in a house I use about 40-50 nights a year, max. I don't know if the $20 is worth the stand, but I guess thats up to you to decide.<br /><br />It trims my beard perfectly and really doesn't make a big mess. My wife has even used this to cut my hair before too, and no issues at all.<br /><br />Definitely worth the money.

  450. I purchased the Philips Norelco G370/60 grooming system after going up and down the price points and reviews here at Amazon and in some local stores.<br /><br />Never having had a hair clipper/beard trimmer before, I had no idea where to start, or which is \\"the one\\", so decided to try this little guy then go from here if necessary.<br /><br />My main objective is to keep a short beard even and clean-looking; secondarily to keep the ear and nose hairs in check and maybe even start learning how to do some hair touch-ups between barbers.<br /><br />The instructions are printed on one of those huge newspaper-type sheets and depend hevily on cross-referenced diagrams. After awhile I gave up on that and went by the descriptions on the clamshell container it shipped in. Not going to take any stars for the instructions but they're pretty pitiful.<br /><br />The basics you need to know are:<br /><br />1. Charge it for 10 hours before using.<br />2. Use the battery all the way up before recharing to get longest life<br />3. The silver squarish button on top in front of the power slider is your head-release button. Hold that in and the blade guard and attachments (such as the nose hair trimmer) come off.<br />4. The beard trimmer and the hair trimmer have a button underneath that allow you to position the trimmer guard closer or further away from the blades. That setting is marked underneath 1 to 9 on the razor and are visible through a little cutout. Also that same guard button is used to take the guards the rest of the way off the razor.<br /><br />That's really about it. I found that if you use the nose-hair trimmer mostly in an in-out motion instead of side-to-side, you will eliminate the pulling some people have mentioned in their reviews.<br /><br />Tip: The reviewers that have mentioned that the body of the trimmer is slick and easy to drop are correct. I took two, 2-inch x 1/2\\" pieces of self-adhesive stair tread tape (like you see on skateboards- from any large Home Supply Store), and attached a strip to each side of the trimmer body just behind the finger cut-outs. Now there's a good solid grip.<br /><br />For the money this little trimmer is really a great value, I actually look forward to using it- it makes a neat job and does not create \\"rows\\" from the trim guards.<br /><br />For the closest shave in bare areas, I follow up with my 3-bladed regular \\"wet\\" razor. Really, you couldn't tell that this was not done in a professional shop. Very pleased.<br /><br />UPDATE December 15, 2012: Still using this on the original battery charge from December 1st and getting good use out of it. How can you beat this for under fourteen bucks shipped with Amazon Prime? :-) I wish someone would have given one to me for Christmas last year!
  451. It willl stay charged a long time. Don't leave it plugged in. Charge it and forget it until it needs another charge.
  452. If you're sick of being a grizzly adams then buy this thing. It's not going to give you a clean shave by any means, but it's great for quick trims to make you look presentable.
  453. This product is worth every penny. It trims to perfection without any plucking sensation. Also it gives various other accessories which are very useful! Would certainly recommend this to others!
  454. Pros<br />- Battery works for upto 6 haircuts<br />- Very light<br />- Adjustable cutting head - No need to change cutting heads / spacers<br /><br />Cons<br />- A bit loud<br />- Cleaning it is a bit difficult<br /><br />Tip: Buy a good scissors and tapered comb to complement this set
  455. I use it all the time to shape the side burns and all. Works great all the different it has work good.
  456. This gets five stars because of its price. I use it as a beard trimmer. A nice bonus is the nose hair trimmer. The blade is sharp, the attachments fit on easily, they are easy to use, and the charger works well. I would say the plastic attachments don't make me confident they will work five years from now, but for the price this is too good to pass up.

  458. I've had this for about 5 years now. Use it once a week for trimming my beard. It's held up great as long as you blow out the hair and keep it clean.<br />You do have to empty the attachments during the trim as it does collect hair and you don't want to burn out the motor, so keep that in mind.
  459. If asked, \\"Would you buy this product again if you had it to do all over?\\" My answer would be \\"In a heartbeat!\\"<br /><br />To begin with I read the instructions. I charged the battery for 10 hours before using and it has run flawlessly for a month without a recharge. You can't just leave this plugged in all the time. Basically, run the battery down and recharge for 10 hours.<br /><br />The trimmer is light and feels good in my hand. The attachments snap in and out easily and they are washable. The blades are sharp and do not require oiling.<br /><br />For years I used Wahl trimmers. In fact, I bought one again but when I got it home it didn't work right so I decided to give this one a try. Frankly, there is no comparison. This Norelco is really that much better than any of the Wahl's I've owned over the years.<br /><br />Adendum: It's been 34 months and still running great. Love it!!
  460. I had a problem with the beard trimmer guards losing teeth after only a few uses. I think this product is very flimsy.
  461. Well, I would not normally order a cordless trimmer (nothing quite like shaving your head, battery dying halfway though, LOL) But a friend suggested it, so I went along. I have pretty thick hair, and my beard was pretty heavy when I received this, but it arrived in perfect shape and fully charged, and I went ahead and used it right away. I used the attachment with the flexible guard to shorten up the hair on my head, then proceed to go shorter to just stubble on my head, then trimmed and shaved my beard with the shaver attachment. All on one charge. Took about a half hour, so I was pretty shocked. I find I actually like it not having a wire to get in the way, or make me have to stay a certain distance from the receptacle. Head attachment swaps are easy as pie, and so is cleanup with the included brush.<br /><br />Pros: Wireless; ease of use; easy of head change, powerful<br /><br />Cons: I have a gut feeling the NiCd (or NiMh, not sure) batteries will wear out over time.<br /><br />Hopefully by the time the NiCd/NiMh batteries where out, I'll have saved money on barbershop head-shaves.<br /><br />I recommend this product!<br /><br />(BTWE, please pardon my spelling/grammer, it's early morning for me and I haven't had my coffee yet. :P

  493. I decided to try growing a small beard, so I bought a $10 Wahl beard trimmer. I liked how the beard was looking and decided to upgrade to something rechargeable. I downgraded my Wahl to manscape and got this because it had a lot more features. I've had this product for 2 months and this is what I can say so far. Battery - Great life. About 40 minutes of life per 10 hour charge. Not a problem if you can time your days properly. You CANNOT plug the unit in and shave if there is no energy in the battery which is a feature that would have been nice to have. Trimmer - There are actually two trimmers. One is wider than the other and the smaller trimmer is supposed to be for fine details. The trimmer attachments only clip on to the wider trimmer! I personally use the wide trimmer with the trimmer attachment then pop off the wide trimmer with the attachment and put the thinner attachment on for detail spots (it's quicker than taking the trimmer attachment on and off). The blades seem to be of good quality and claim that they don't need oil or sharpening. They are easy on the skin (unlike a previous Remington unit that cut me without attachments). Trimmer Attachments - There is a hair clipper and a beard trimmer attachment. Again, they attach to the big trimmer only. I enjoy how the beard trimmer has a tension which hugs your face on the various curves. You can adjust the length easily. People claim that this breaks easily; while the design could have been better, only a great force of pushing the unit to your face will cause it to break. And if it does break, a simple examination of how the attachment works, a paper clip, and super glue will fix it. Again, this product is $16, don't expect titanium components. I haven't used the hair clippers yet, but i'm sure the battery will last long enough for a good cut. The Foil Shaver Attachment - It hurts me and i have to go over a spot several times because it is so small. I just use the smaller trimmer and leaveit or use my other shaver or razor. Nose/Eyebrow Trimmer - OW! This tends to pull a lot. My $10 Wahl trimmer came with nose trimmer and it worked a lot better. Stand/Brush - Good. Sleek looking. You get so much for the price. Amazing. The broken trimmer attachment seems easily fixable. Only $16. I Highly Recommend this.
  494. I have used this grooming set for several months. A quick idea of my usage; on Sundays, I use it for grooming nose, ears,mustache and 'soul patch', trimming sideburns and neckline. I do not use it for 'haircuts'. Using it in this manner, I find it to be ideal and it is a great value. If you are 'ham-handed' you may find it 'fiddly/delicate' as it certainly is not built like a 50s era Kirby vacuum cleaner. Also, I find I can use it twice easily before recharging it. The nose hair trimmer will require 30-40 seconds per nostril I think as you need to turn, and change angles a lot to be thorough. And changing attachments will occasionally require me to flip the switch on for half a second to re-align the clutch mechanism. If you feel any resistance snapping on a different head - try hitting the switch. Now, are there any negatives? Yeah, but for my usage they are minor. For some folks they could be a problem. Mine came with a travel pouch. I don't see how the various attachments could avoid damaging themselves rattling around in a pouch together. I'd place them in individual sandwich bags or wrap them in tissue if they had to travel in such a way they might bang/press into each other. I doubt I will ever travel with any part of this set though. Also, it's slightly annoying having to rotate the heads to align them into the stand's receptacle/'wells'. They should have made the stand in such a way the parts could be dropped in without worrying about 'polarity'. EDIT; update, almost 6 years old and every component works like new - and there's no detectable reduction in the battery's performance either.

  515. So, this is going to sound a bit Negative-Nancy, and is loooong. But here goes:<br /><br />In late May 2010, I purchased the T980. I was looking to replace my then nearly 10 year-old cheapo Norelco trimmer that had finally bit the dust. I went for the T980 because, well, I decided the beard was here to stay, so might as well invest in a \\"higher quality\\" trimmer. The T980 was Norelco's initial \\"vacuum\\" trimmer (it has a little built in vacuum that's supposed to suck in the hair as you trim). It was a bit big, and yes the \\"turbo\\" setting was loud, but for all intents and purposes, it worked well, and the vacuum feature was a nice touch (not perfect, but did greatly reduce the errant hairs all over the sink/tub). Less than a year and a half later, the adjustable beard trimmer attachment broke. Two of the plastic guides/teeth just snapped. I wasn't doing anything out of the oridnary, and had never done anything to damage the unit or attachments. The teeth just snapped off mid-trim. Well, that was annoying, but I figured \\"hey, no problem. I'll just replace that one little part. Easy!\\"<br /><br />After scouring the web for replacement parts with no luck, I contacted Norelco directly. They informed me that they no longer made my unit, as they had released version 2 of my model. Which didn't have compatible parts. Furthermore, no other parts existed that would fit my trimmer. I figured surely they must have some older parts left, but was told no, no more parts for my model existed. So then I asked if I could get a refund or discounted price for the newer model. Nope!<br /><br />Begrudgingly, I decided to just buy another entire unit, but this time, go back to the cheapo model. Enter the G370.<br /><br />I have had the G370 almost exactly 1 year now with no complaints whatsoever...untie last weekend, when the exact same part broke. This time I went straight to Norelco. I knew they still made the G370. I knew they would have parts. After a 20min chat with one of their reps, he finally dug up the product code for the part I needed. Two problems though: 1) it actually wasn't the right part - it was the hair trimmer attachment, I needed the beard trimmer; and 2) when I found the right part on my own, it cost almost $17...before tax and shipping!! While I am amazed to find that the G370 now costs over $50, I paid about $13 for it when I bought it a year ago. So there's no way I'm paying ~$30 for a small, crappy, plastic replacement part. And, once again, I was informed no discount or refund of any kind would be provided.<br /><br />So, long story short: Norelco's trimmers are great, but their attachments and customer service/loyalty are abhorrent. I am now off to buy my 3rd trimmer in as many years just because of a stupid, flimsy plastic part. Needless to say, I will NOT be buying Norelco. Ever. Had I paid what this unit is now selling for, I'd be even more furious. Buyer beware.e finally dug up the product code for the part I needed. Two problems though: 1) it actually wasn't the right part - it was the hair trimmer attachment, I needed the beard trimmer; and 2) when I found the right part on my own, it cost almost $17...before tax and shipping!! While I am amazed to find that the G370 now costs over $50, I paid about $13 for it when I bought it a year ago. So there's no way I'm paying ~$30 for a small, crappy, plastic replacement part. And, once again, I was informed no discount or refund of any kind would be provided.<br /><br />So, long story short: Norelco's trimmers are great, but their attachments and customer service/loyalty are abhorrent. I am now off to buy my 3rd trimmer in as many years just because of a stupid, flimsy plastic part. Needless to say, I will NOT be buying Norelco. Ever. Had I paid what this unit is now selling for, I'd be even more furious. Buyer beware.

So you have to exercise care when switching them out and when cleaning the whole system. Also, after only using it four times and charging it three times, the rechargeable batteries will not take a charge anymore. Now this almost new trimmer is nothing but a useless paperweight. From now on I'll stick with a corded trimmer. They're not as convenient, but at least they'll be more reliable. Don't waste your hard earned cash on this piece of junk.
