  537. For how much i paid for it and the use i have gotten out of it, its great. I never really bothered with beard trimmers until recently, I'm older now. I have tried foil shaver and such just because i had them in my stocking on xmas when i was a teen and i know i don't like them now. Well since i moved into my 20's i can tell you i now need to do some maintenance... everywhere. I picked this up the price wasn't bad and i have used it since maybe its been about a year? or longer. I clean up my stubble with it it does OK lines. I use the foil shaver a bit just to do outlines take multiple passes. The foil shaver isn't the best i need to take the head off and brush off the little blades because they get dirty easy.<br /><br /> The nose hair trimmer is EHH Not to sure about it i don't have enough hair to see if it works well but i don't think its to great maybe in a bind it would be fine. I use the hair comb for body hair length like leg hair and well below the wast type trimming. I have yet to try and use the clippers without the comb i would not recommend it just by looking at the cutters you might pinch the sack nicely. The clipper heads stay sharp, i think they are self sharpening but i am not sure don't quote me. I use the precision head once in awhile its OK it still a bit to big for really fine work imho. I used it to cut my hair once its not good for that if your hair hasn't been touched in 2-3 months. For longer hair its a pain. for maintaining hairs its ok at it. But like i said anything not maintained and you want to clean up its a pain in the ass although i used the beard comb instead of the hair comb. I had lost it for a little bit.<br /><br /> I could be wrong on this but the beard comb clogged and had to be removed and rinsed a lot. It holds a charge quite long i don't charge it to often. It only has started to bog down after heavy use like emergency hair trimming where i couldn't get to a barber before something important the next day in the morning. Imight add i had used to before without charging it about 5 times. So if you have to clean your head up i would have a full charge. SO all in all its ok the levels for hair are good i wish it had height adjustments for half increments on the beard comb,it would make fading a nicer feature but for how much it cost you cant go wrong and you can still fade with it you just have to use full step increments 1,2,3,4,5 ect.<br /><br /> Also note this is not a shaver. This is for stubble, cleaning up lines and beard maintenance or if you need to cut a beard down so you can use a razor blade. in no way will this give you a skin close shave. Would i buy it again? sure i would for how much i paid you cant go wrong. But i will be purchasing the Norelco Multi groom pro next so maybe ill review that after i have used it for a year or so.<br /><br /> edit (12/1/2013) I gave it a forth star i ended up using it again for hair with the hair comb this time. it did clog but much less. and i had a full charge this time so has proven it self to me in a pinch yet again
  538. This is a good razor. I don't follow the instructions for charging or cleaning the device, and it still works great. Very durable for the lazy person within.
  539. got it for grandson he loves it'. It's quick and easy to stay groomed at all times Stays sharp too
  540. Great product and service!
  541. This thing really holds its charge. I rarely have to charge it. It has done a good job cleaning up my neck and sideburns. It comes with a lot of useful attachments and you can't knock the price. A good value purchase!
  542. This product uses cheap replacement adjusteable heads which break easily. I bought this item twice and won't make the same mistake again. And I'm not the only one with this problem... Just read all thos 1-star rating comments and you'll see what I'm talking about.
  543. Battery takes 10 hours to charge: you better be charged before you start trimming! I wasn't charged enough and had to go on a date with half my head shaved! You have about 35 minutes of use before the charge dies.<br /><br />While the clipper itself seems durable, the beard and hair trimmer that came with mine both fell apart during the same week. They were just sitting on my desk untouched between uses and the beard trimmer was in two pieces, half the tines on the hair trimmer had fallen off. These clearly have a shelf-life and did not last very long. Philips does not cover the parts in their warranty.<br /><br />The trimmer is also under powered and chokes on my moderately thick hair.<br /><br />Philips customer service is the worst I've ever encountered. As politely as possible, I asked on of the reps if their job is even intended to help customers: he said \\"no, their job is mostly to deflect complaints.\\" After that, he seemed to genuinely be trying to help me, but none of the reps I talked to knew even the basic information about Philips' policies or products.<br /><br />Since this clipper broke, I reluctantly tried another, higher-end (QT407)0) Philips trimmer and it was equally as low-quality. I'm currently struggling to get them to send me a return slip before the 45-day guarantee expires, but the customer service rep said Philips intentionally makes it very difficult to return a product on the guarantee: you have to keep the trimmer for 3 weeks of the 45-days and it takes a week for Philips to process a return request, so you really have something like a 10-day period to return the product. I'm probably going back to a Wahl trimmer - I had my last one for 10 years before the blade got dull and I unfortunately decided to try Philips.
  544. This was bought as a Christmas gift for my husband four years ago and he loves it and uses it daily. It still runs great and he recommends it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced daily groomer.
  545. muy bueno, entrega rapida y sin problemas. El producto es uno de los mejores que existen! no hay comparación con ninguno

  551. This norelco all in 1 is amazing...plenty of attachments that work, and the beard comb/trimmer works perfect for me; it has 9 settings that are easy to use and see what setting youre on, it's quiet, does the job quickly. In 2 minutes my beard is perfectly groomed. attachments attach/detach quickly and easily. it comes with a storage bag. And I swear this thing never needs recharged. It's been in use for a month now and still doesnt need recharged!
  552. My old Conair cheap-o trimmer gave up the ghost, so I headed to Wally World to find a replacement. I needed something more than a simple electric nose hair trimmer, and I found this nice little number.<br /><br />The unit has a ni-cad rechargable battery so you CANNOT KEEP IT PLUGGED IN 24/7. That negates just about all the negative reviews for this product. If you want that kind of feature, you'll have to upgrade to one of the Norelco trimmers with a li-ion battery. The trimmer has a 45 day return policy to the manufacturer, so keep your receipt.<br /><br />As I said, I was looking for more than a nose hair trimmer. I wanted nose, ear, eyebrow, sideburns, and the ability to do a little trim around the ears in between haircuts. Actually, I don't have a beard or mustache, but I might grow a 'stache again someday. Anyway.... this little inexpensive trimmer comes with all the attachments you may need. The cutting blades cut smoothly with no grabbing or pulling. I've been using it for about three weeks on one charge (but I do not use it every day, and when I do it's only a few minutes). The attachments are easy to remove and put on. and the trimmer guides are adjustable. It also comes with a little foil shaver attachment that I thought was a pretty cool feature, although I don't know how or when I'll ever use it.<br /><br />One thing I don't like is the on/off switch. It's a slider switch with a small indentation, and a little tab in the middle. I have to use a fingernail on it to slide the switch. It's not easy to do with just your thumb. It's kind of hard to slide it, but I guess maybe that's better than too loose.<br /><br />Also, the trimmer does not come with a stand to hold the trimmer and attachments, like my old Conair. You'll have to find some way to keep them all together. It does come with a travel pouch but that's not conducive to day-to-day use.<br /><br />Overall, if you are looking for a cheap trimmer for incidental trimming, this works very well.
  553. Compared to my 10-year old trimmer, this thing is a gem. Comes with attachments for all levels of trimming, charges so you don't go thru batteries every other trim, and doesn't snag nearly as much as my previous one.

Like I said, I'm only comparing it to the cheap models I've had before; but this trimmer is simply a joy to use. So much so, that I've been trimming my beard every few days to keep it looking real clean. Setting 2 has me at 2-3 days growth. Setting 1 would be, my guess, just stubble. Not once has it pulled a hair out. The floating comb attachment for the beard trimmer really works to keep the cut super clean and even. I haven't even had to recharge it yet. Used the nose trimmer for my nose, ears and brows. Same perfect results. Clean, fast cut with no pulls. Even used the shaver head to clean up the strays above my beard a few times.<br /><br />If your looking for a cheap shaver - go for it.   647. I'm a 27 year old male with nice thick hair. I use a head trimmer for under my neck since it cuts the hair short but doesn't leave bad razor burn. I use Norelco stubble shaver for my \\"beard\\" I like the 5 o clock shadow look. My mustache hair is VERY thick, and can slow even the most powerful motors down. I will say that I don't really spend big money on razors since I bought a $150.00 unit that did nothing better than my $30 unit. So for my $40 MAX for a trimmer. They seem to last me a few years, with both my shaver and my trimmer going on 3-4 years now with no problem.<br /><br />I was at Target today December 1st 2012, and bought this on sale since I have been wanting an \\"all-in one\\" picked it up for $16 with tax. I just tried it out, and all I can say is that I'm very happy with it. cut right through my mustache like butter, and with one of the attachable heads it turns in to a 5 o clock trimmer like my $35 dollar Norelco stubble trimmer. I may also add that it does a much better job than the dedicated stubble trimmer, since it seems to do everything in one pass and does it very evenly, I find myself having to do multiple passes with the Dedicated stubble trimmer, and even then you can tell it didn't do an even job, although since the hair is short, and my hair grows fast, I don't worry to much, I'm not picky. I will say that the foil shaver is kinda lame, doesn't seem to do much, but I was kinda dirty, and my hair was stuck to my skin, so I'll try it again in a week after a nice hot shower. Every other attachment works well. I knock off a half star for the foil shaver, and a half star for not being able to use it plugged in, which makes no sense to me... why not?! I should knock it down to 3 stars, but I'm afraid this would detour people from buying it, and it really is a good shaver, if those little quirks dont matter, then you you get a good \\"bang for your buck,\\". Now if I decide to return this unit, for the Whal, which I am told is made in the US, I will not only update this review, but give a good honest comparison.<br /><br />I will keep updating this review from time to time, and if you have any questions feel free to ask, I'll pop back in.<br /><br />For the $16, if I get 6-12 months use, I will feel as though I've got my money worth, anything past that, and I'll buy another with out hesitation.only update this review, but give a good honest comparison.<br /><br />I will keep updating this review from time to time, and if you have any questions feel free to ask, I'll pop back in.<br /><br />For the $16, if I get 6-12 months use, I will feel as though I've got my money worth, anything past that, and I'll buy another with out hesitation.

I've only had it since today so I don't know what it's longevity will be, but I've owned Phillips products in the past and found them to last a long time.   661. I researched several different all-in-one beard trimming systems before I bought the Norelco G370. I was most concerned about the battery life - one of the biggest complaints about this and other all-in-one systems. I made my purchase in March 2011, charged the battery for 24 hours (as recommended) and didn't have to charge the battery again for another 5 months (August). For me, the battery is not a problem. The all-in-one system is easy to use. The attachments snap on and off with ease and are easy to clean (I use a can of compressed air). It is on the noisy side, which is most noticable when I use it to trim the hair in my ears. But you shouldn't expect perfection for $20. For the money, I give it 5 stars and would recommend the G370 to anyone.<br /><br />UPDATE: It's now September 2012 and my G370 is still working. I have only charged the battery twice since I purchased it. Letting the battery expend itself before charging will extend the life of the battery. I clean it every time I use it so hair particles don't clog the attachments. I am still very pleased with this product. I didn't expect it to last more than a year, but it keeps going, and going, and...

  674. This is the third Norelco \\"Groomer\\" I have owned over the past dozen or so years. Following the trend of most small appliances these days, they have continued to get cheaper in price, but also lower in quality. This model does a decent job (I use it as a beard trimmer) but it's smaller, noisier, and doesn't do as good a job as its immediate predecessor (about $35 on Amazon 4 or 5 years ago), or the best; my first Norelco model about a dozen years ago ($70 at Target). So I'd say it's a good deal considering the low price.<br /><br />Frankly, I'd rather have paid the $70 for the old, superior model, which worked faster and quieter.

I don't get it as bad as others do, but my skin is sensitive so typically after shaving with a razor, I have to wait about 3 days before my next razor shave or else my skin gets reddish and painfully irritated. I still have to wait, but now I have been using the micro-screen attachment in those 3-day periods and it doesn't irritate, and I can look more presentable. Years ago, I tried another very popular brand micro-screen shaver and it felt like someone snatching out my facial hair - quite painful. So I am happy to report that this one does not do that at all.<br /><br />My brother and nephew both have similar shaving issues, and I'm going to buy one of these for them too!<br /><br />UPDATE: I've owned this for close to a month now and I use it all the time, and am very surprised that I literally have only had to charge it ONE TIME...now that's efficiency. But as it gets older its loses charge over a year or two of regular usage. Not a big deal considering the low price. My main thing is that I REALLY wish Philips made a clone version of this trimmer that worked while plugged in so that if it dies in mid cut you could just plug it in and have it keep running. This is not an issue except for one of the beard trimmers. As you use this attachment, you'll inclined to push it against your skin and this weakens the plastic guides that are attached to the fixture on one side only. Therefore, you tend to fatigue them and the guides start falling off after about 1 to 1.5 years for me. However, for the price of this item, it is definitely worth it in my opinion.

  758. I had this for about year .. I liked if for a while, but it didn't take too long for it to show its flaws.<br /><br />The blades dull fast, leaving a choppy looking cut. The unit has to be at full charge to run, which takes 10 hours. You cannot plug it in to have it operate.<br /><br />The attachments are a nice feature, but aren't all that useful. The unit is made so cheaply that while trying to adjust the cutting length, the cutting head separates from the unit... It snaps back on, but still is more aggravating than it should be.<br /><br />The unit is egg-shell delicate. One short fumble into the sink and the main blade guard splintered into several pieces.<br /><br />I paid less than the price here, and I feel ripped off.

  764. Only problems with this are ... almost everything.<br />- There are actually a confusing number of options and sometimes figuring out which parts go together takes way longer than it should.<br />- There are two head sizes and a guide that fits over each one that controls the length you are cutting too. Unfortunately, in almost all cases, there don't seem to be detents for the settings; the guides just slide. So if you put a little pressure on, you all of a sudden are cutting your beard a lot shorter than you intended.<br />- Got one nasty cut from a bare blade (well, not bare but without any extra guard; the normal way you'd use it to shave your head).<br />- All of the attachments feel cheap and I don't expect them to last.<br /><br />Really sorry I spent money on this.

  770. I actually bought a second one of these trimmers to keep as a backup in case my first one breaks. It's a great trimmer and works better than any other I've owned, including profession clippers. My only complaint is that you can't use it while it's plugged in. It's either you're shaving with it, or you're charging it, no mixing of both worlds. My advice is charge it for about 4-5 hours after every use, because the trimmer gets weaker the lower the battery power gets and it won't shave as well. Excellent trimmer overall.
  771. I have waxed for years, but it is time-consuming to do at home and expensive at a salon (I'm also an esthetician, so I don't like paying for it when I can do it myself- a pretty literal case of \\"Who shaves the barber?\\"). I usually shave with a regular blade, but that can also be time-consuming, especially if you have not been maintaining your garden. Personally, being hair-free is not really on the top of my list of things to do when I am single and not ready to mingle! I purchased this groomer to trim the lilac bush to a decent length before finishing off with a blade. I looked at some of the pricier models that are especially for body grooming, but for $12.99, this seemed to be able to perform exactly the function I needed- to trim the hair without mangling the fancy china. The biggest selling point for me was that the attachments, even the main trimmer attachment, can be removed and rinsed off. I do not have the patience to be cleaning up little hairs with that teeny brush, so this feature scores major points with me.<br /><br />Out of the Box: I truly despise the plastic shrink-wrapping packing that is so ubiquitous these days, but I managed to open it without breaking into a full-on sweat. I appreciate the small, nylon bag that is provided to store the attachments, but it would be great if this came in box that could be used to organize and store it between uses.<br /><br />The plastic body is lightweight but sturdy and the seams are clean and smooth. For my purposes, the size and weight is perfect. A rubberized coating would be an improvement on the buttons, as the on/off slides up and down and you need some grip, but there is a little notch that you can grab with your fingernail. The buttons are also shallow, so there is no threat of breaking them off. The two comb attachments might be considered a bit on the flimsy side, but they should hold up fine because pressure is unnecessary while using them. The rest of the attachments feel very solid and theyall slide on and off and lock into place smoothly. If you are using one of the comb attachments, it is easier to first slide it onto the trimmer attachment and adjust the height before you attach to the unit. I tested all of the attachments except the beard/mustache comb, but I may try it next time, as the manual says that its lowest setting (1) is 2mm, compared to 4mm on the clipper attachment and I am looking to get the closest trim I can. There are two charts showing the length of the settings in the manual [...].<br /><br />I used the unit right from the box and it was surprisingly quiet. I used the clipper comb at setting 1 and mowed the lawn in seconds. I did not have any tugging or pulling on the hair.<br /><br />I then tested the trimmer without the comb attachment and it worked well and trimmed down to a stubble. It's very important to pull the skin taught and not put any pressure on it whatsoever. I can't stress this enough because you will get nicks and cuts if you press down at all, especially in fleshier areas. I wouldn't recommend that anyone trim without the guard unless you are an experienced shaver and/or take a lot of care while doing so.<br /><br />I switched to the precision trimmer, which is a smaller version of the standard trimmer head and went in for some detail work. Owwie Wowwie! Totally my bad for going in so willy-nilly, but I found out the hard way that it is not only smaller in size, but the teeth are much shorter too. I will not be trying this again on the lower deck and I wouldn't recommend it for anyone else either. Since it is so close and precise, it is a nice attachment for guys cleaning up their sideburns, goatees or more complicated facial hair.<br /><br />I don't have any visible nose or ear hairs, but I tested the attachment anyway. I put it into my nostril a few mms and swirled it around. I have no results to report.<br /><br />Finally, I attached the mini-shaver and used it on the peach fuzz on my upper lip (of my face!) :) I have fine, blonde hair and it is hardly noticeable, but the shaver did not remove the hair. I re-attached the trimmer and went over it first, then the shaver worked great. The hair needs to be barely there and sticking straight up or it will not go into the tiny holes in the foil. I used a small circular motion and the hair disappeared quickly. I'm sure this would work well on the bikini area after a close trim, but it is so small that it would take forever- perfect for the face though.<br /><br />Time spent: less than 15 minutes<br /><br />Total stars: 5 -I am sure there are better trimmers in existence, but the low price, the variety of attachments, and the convenience of cleaning make this a great product.<br /><br />Total euphemisms for the vagina/pubic hair used in review- 7
  772. Husband bought these for trimming his facial hair. The different attachments are practical and pretty precise. We even used them once to touchup his haircut. Charge seems to hold well. For the price, these works very well.

  774. So why the 3 stars?<br />I bought this one about 6 months ago after being impressed with the reviews.<br /><br />And about 2 months ago the motor would just not work every now and then. So I put it on recharge and then removed the clipper thingy, rotated the motor rod - which basically is the one that causes the blades to vibrate back and forth- and then it worked. And then after sometime it got completely stuck and i could not even hear the motor sound, so I had to clean the head - pull out the vibrator thingy and clean the whole thing as some hair has gotten into it!!<br />And then for the last 1 month or so it seems to be working fine.<br />As far the blades are concerned they are decently sharp and get the trimming work done.<br /><br />So you basically get what you pay for. Before this one I had the remington trimmer which was probably the same price or maybe 10 bucks more, and it worked good for about 2 yrs until it totally shut of one day all of a sudden. So next time probably I will go back to remington as this one does not seem to be that sturdy.

  793. At this point with so many reviews of this trimmer there is not really much I can add that will be too helpful I'm afraid. Suffice it to say that this is a very well priced shaver/trimmer that has all the attachments one could want for everything from trimming hair, to that of your nose and ears as well. It's small, easy to hold and handle, and shaped in such a way that makes even doing ones back of the neck easy. It charges up quickly and lasts long enough to do several trimming jobs before you need to plug it in again. About the only couple of things I can say I don't like about this trimmer is there is no stand that comes with it for storing it upright in between charges. (but they do give you a little nylon bag to store all the attachments in). That wouldn't be so bad, save for the fact that the trimmers bottom is very small and it tips over easily when you just set it down upright. It would have been nice if they either offered a little stand to store it in, or made the base of the unit a little bigger for stability. The other is a minor irritant, but one that I am sure many will well identify with. The instruction booklet is not a booklet at all but one of those big thin fold out papers like the the old road maps. Its in 40 languages like everything is these days and its very difficult to read it when all spread out and follow it in English or any other language. And trust me, you should read the instructions on this before just trying it out. It helps with getting used to how the different heads attach and are most efficient. All in all however despite these two minor issues this is a very reasonably priced trimmer that will do the job nicely for most of us, and I recommend it...
  794. My husband likes this grooming set well enough. His nose hair trimmer piece doesn't work, but for the price you really can't expect them all to work. It's a good value, but don't buy it for the attachments.

  804. I first purchased the Schick quattro because it had a small beard trimmer and was waterproof. It had some great reviews and it seemed like a good product for what it was but I noticed the teeth in the trimmer seemed too tight allow some of my beard hair to trim down to a decent height. This Philips Norelco G370 unit has plenty of space between the teeth to allow my hair to enter and make contact with the cutting blades. The other attachments help make this a fine tuning grooming machine. The mesh micro screen attachment is a little on the small side and resembles a tiny braun razor head. It does cut the stubble and works for small areas but it takes so long for my neck that I tend to use my regular full sized razor instead. So far the battery charge has lasted a long time and it looks simple enough that when it does finally die I think I will be able to replace it with some other solder tabbed rechargeable batteries and a little bench time.
  805. I hate paying for haircuts. I always feel like I'm spending money for something I'm never completely satisfied with, and it's something that over the last few years I have learned to do myself (it's a pretty simple, short haircut). But I hated how long it was taking me with scissors, so I was in Walmart last week comparing a few different electric clippers. I went on my amazon app, and this was one of them. I thought for sure the $50 model would get better reviews than this little $20 Norelco, but I was surprised that the more expensive one got only 1.5 starts, while this one was 4+ stars! So I figured, what the heck.<br /><br />I made sure to read the directions (very glad I did or I would have cut WAY too short). I used the hair clipper attachment, set it to #9 on top and #7 on sides, going over it several times to make sure it was evenly trimmed, and it worked perfectly! And it took me only a third the time it normally takes me!<br /><br />Unfortunately I have shaving bumps and sensitive skin on my neck, so I don't think I'll be able to utilize the other attachments as much, but the bottom line is this shaver works like a champ. I have been using this grooming system every day for quite a while, and I am very pleased with it.<br /><br />The rechargeable battery lasts pretty long. I have not allowed to battery to wind down completely, so I can't say the length of time the battery actually lasts.<br /><br />It comes with plenty of attachments. I have used most of them and I have had no problems with them. The attachments just click onto the shaver and hold fast.<br /><br />I have not experienced any problems with this system at all. This grooming system is certainly not a piece of junk. I think it can handle pretty much anything you can throw at it!<br /><br />All in all, I would recommend this grooming system to anyone who needs to maintain their facial hair!

  846. It has everything I need and is perfect. The storage bag is key, and is much better than the counter-top storage trays which have to stay out and when bumped everything falls off the tray. Battery seems like it will last forever as using this a few minutes every couple of days just with the factory charged seemed to last for weeks? I bought a $50 trimmer and upon seeing this ordered it instead and it is much better! The possibilities are endless with it. Also when trimming my beard or goatee it is important to know that whatever size you set this to, it stays put! I am rough with a trimmer on my face and always worry the size will drop down and cut all my hair off accidentally. This stays put with a decent amount of pressure!

  865. The system overall is good. BUT, the nose/ear/eyebrow attachment doesn't work too well on ear hair. I STILL get better results just by using my razor on my ear hair...albeit VERY CAREFULLY!! But it works fine on eyebrows and nose hair. The included instructions are lengthy and detailed which I LIKE.<br /> But here's the mess: once you read the instructions, you learn that you should NOT keep the device on power charge via an electric outlet. Seems that will only run down the battery!! Thus, you're supposed to use this device until the battery runs down, and ONLY then plug it in to an outlet to re-charge the battery. Well....that is NUTS! We all know what'll happen: the ONE time I'm in a hurry to get ready, with no time to spare, will be THE TIME the battery goes down. Instructions say re-charge can take 10-12 hours. That is NUTS.<br /> This device is sorely in need of new/better batteries. I should be able to leave this thing on charge whenever I'm not using it so that WHEN I pick it up to use it the battery is always always fully charged. VERY poor planning on Norelco's part.
  866. There's nothing fancy about this trimming system. It's just a superb, solid and reliable basic system. We got one for our son. My own was supposed to be &#34;better.&#34; Not only did the &#34;better&#34; system not compare, it died. I replaced it with this.
  867. Saw reviews complaining that this is made, largely, of plastic and is not as good quality as more expensive models. Well, then capitalism seems to be working because I EXPECT a more expensive shaver to be of better quality. I don't buy a Taurus and complain it's not a BMW!! I have used this for a few months now and love the thing. Yes, I'm very careful changing attachments because they are made of plastic, but once in place they do the job they are supposed to do. I, primarily, use the beard trimmer which I find to be excellent. The nose/ear hair trimmer is fine too. Saw postings about pulling hair - have experienced NONE of that. The foil shaver does not give a terribly close shave - not good enough for a primary shaver, but in a pinch will clean you up!<br />Bottom line, there are $50 shavers out there that are worth $50. This is a $14 shave that's worth $30.
  868. Out of the package this shaver is great. It took me a couple tries to figure out how to attach the different heads but it was easier than I was trying to make it.
  869. It's a pesonal grooming kit which is really good to have it does its job its a bargain exactly for the price totally recommend it
  870. I recently bought a [[ASIN:B003XU1BSY Wahl Groomsman]], which is a compact sized groomer, with a nice set of attachments and accessories. One thing the Wahl didn't have however, was a nostril hair trimmer, so when this Philips Norelco groomer went on sale for $10, I decided to get it, mostly because it does have a nostril hair trimmer. I didn't really need another grooming set, but paying only $10 for a nostril hair trimmer, didn't seem that outrageous.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed, was that the Norelco motor makes a lot more noise, when compared to the Wahl, which makes a low humming sound. The Norelco motor is raspy, and it sounds like there is a lot of friction. Strangely, while the quieter Wahl comes with a bottle of machine oil, Norelco claims that their groomer requires no lubrication. It's not the most pleasant experience, sticking a noisy nostril trimmer into your nose, and it gets hot pretty fast, but it does a decent job.<br /><br />Besides the nostril hair trimmer, the Norelco has attachment heads for a hair clipper, a precision clipper, and a mini-shaver, with clip on combs for hair, moustaches, and beards. These seem a bit oversized, but work pretty well, although the spacing between the comb teeth is rather wide. While Norelco provides 2 comb attachments and a carrying pouch, the Wahl set comes with 7 assorted combs, and a zippered bag.<br /><br />At only about 0.6\\" wide, the mini-shaver is quite small. It works well enough, but again it's rather noisy. The fit of some of the attachments isn't that secure. A little too much pressure in a certain direction, and the mini-shaver, or nostril trimmer pop off. Putting the release button immediately above the power switch, where it can accidentally be pressed, isn't a smart decision, and is another indication that workmanship and attention to detail, is just a little lacking. The Norelco is decent grooming tool, but it's a bit rough around the edges. Having used both products, I prefer the Wahl Groomsman, but many don't happen to agree, as the Norelco is a top seller at Amazon. My cost of only $10, is a major factor in my 4 star rating.e Wahl Groomsman, but many don't happen to agree, as the Norelco is a top seller at Amazon. My cost of only $10, is a major factor in my 4 star rating.

  890. My husband has been using beard trimmers to cut his head hair for many years and has gone though a few of them. The best one was an old Norelco which you could use off of AC power or on battery power. Unfortunately, someone stole it from him and I hope they enjoyed it because he would not only trim his head hair with said product. Next was this one which lasted quite a few years but just recently stopped holding a charge. Since you can not operate product plugged in it was rendered useless and this new purchase for the exact model is replacing it. He likes the fade ranges and ease of use selecting a trim height. Sometimes your finger could accidently release the trimmer head from the body which is inconvenient. From a quality perspective it doesnt last too long, he is just replacing it because it is familiar to him and he is used to it but do not expect to get 10 years out of this because once the battery goes it is useless. But for 14 bucks the amount of money you save not getting haircuts or getting waxed makes it worth it.
  891. I've owned a number of beard trimmers, and I fell for the low price of this one. That was a mistake. Like I always say, \\"Buy Right, Buy Once, Buy Wrong, Buy Twice.\\" This thing is poorly made, the attachments feel sort of loose when clicked in place, and some of them come off while you're using the trimmer. It will nick you if you aren't careful, and the recharge stand is BIG, which takes up a lot of space. The attachments fit loosely in the stand, which means that every time you brush them with a towel or your hand, or a power cord, they fall out of the stand, which is irritating. The plastic is cheap as hell. The trimmer does a good job of trimming, in general, but you'll definitely have the feeling that you're using a piece of junk. The charging base gets full of hair clippings, which isn't great, and the plastic on the base is about as cheap as can be. Can't anyone make quality products anymore? What I really wanted was a BRAUN beard trimmer, but they apparently don't make the damn thing anymore! BRAUN makes GOOD stuff...
  892. This model is one that, fortunately, Philips has chosen not to change because this model works great the way that it is! If you treat it with care (I've dropped a few and that's an immediate action for the garbage can) if you use the model's number features to cut hair at different levels, i.e., 1, 2, 3 - 10, I believe is the max setting. Should you drop it, this plastic trimming head will fall to pieces and your left with a razor that only cuts without any type of guard or trimmer, which I use to shave my head, for example. Because I use it several times/week, I find that each one of these ~$20 models needs to be replaced every 12-18 months. This still seems like a good product to me since I'm saving all of that money getting my head shaved professionally. Sure, in an ideal world Philips would create a stronger guide/trimmer to prevent people from cutting their hair at the wrong level, but then again, this is a trimmer that's not designed to, in my opinion, shave one's head with any level of precision so if you use this with the guard on for shaving heads of hair with any kind of cutting style (short on sides, longer on top) then I'd suggest purchasing a more professional model instead of this trimmer.

  932. I use this to both trim my beard and cut my hair. It works well for both, but seems to take forever to charge. I'm a procrastinator and so I tend to put off trimming my beard and cutting my hair until the same time(or I used to. At full charge, and being left plugged in the entire time I use it, it runs out of power about half way through cutting my hair if I have used it on my face before hand. So you can't really use it while it's plugged up, it doesn't draw power as fast as it uses it. I have to leave it plugged up over night about before it's usable. But, other than the power issue it works great.

  935. I needed to replace an old, battery operated Norelco trimmer. A friend recommended this trimmer to me. I don't shave or trim my beard daily, but I use it frequently enough. I've only had to charge it twice, and one of those charges was when I took it out of the box.<br /><br />I needed a trimmer that had multiple attachments, and this fit the bill. Multiple setting beard trimmer, multiple setting hair trimmer, large and precision trimmer, small foil shaver, even a nose hair trimmer. All of the attachments click into place easily and are removable. The beard trimmer trims quickly and evenly. The foil shaver works perfectly for small areas. I haven't used the hair or nose trimmer.<br /><br />I've been really impressed with this grooming kit, I hope it lasts for a long time.

  942. works great, attachments are easy to change. This would not replace your every day razor, but is great for clippers and trims.
  943. I use this primarily as a beard trimmer and it suits that purpose well enough. It does not choke on my hair at all, and nothing gets caught.<br /><br />I wish that the hair trimmer had higher settings. I use the hair trimmer comb (It includes a shorted beard comb which is not nearly long enough for me) on the highest setting for my beard. I use the detail trimmer to define the edges of my beard and the foil shaver to shave that down to nothing.<br /><br />They claim 35 minutes of battery and I believe them because I have not encountered an issue with run time. Because it uses NiMH batteries, it does require charging before use if it has been sitting for a while, maybe even a couple of weeks. Because it includes a very simple trickle charge, it should not be left on the charger constantly, or the batteries will wear out prematurely and run times will get unusably short. Unlike other similar shavers, the charger shuts off while the shaver is running, so it cannot be used like a typical plug-in charger. The batteries are also not replaceable. For these reasons, the shaver has a limited lifespan.<br /><br />I have mixed feelings about even giving 4 stars for the above reasons, but if you go into it thinking you'll have it for a couple of years and toss it and that it costs only $25, I'd say it's a good deal overall.
  944. I am on my second set of these trimmers. I've had it about 5 years. The only problem is the flimsy head/hair spacers break eventually.<br /><br />It is a good set though. I use it to trim my beard, trim nose hair and trim my neck between haircuts. It works good for all of these. Just keep in mind not to use it roughly and it will last longer.<br />Battery life is very good. I don't have an outlet close to it so I have to charge it and unplug it to use it. I wanted to replace it with the same exact model since it had been such a great trimmer but it has been replaced by the G370. The difference is the G270 came with an upright stand that held all the utensils while the newer G370 comes with a bag and an extra utensil not included years ago. Lucky for me the newer one fits in the older versions charging stand so I only had to transfer all of the new stuff into the old charging stand and I'm good for hopefully another 7 - 8 years. I've had nothing but great luck with Philips Norelco trimmers and I strongly suggest this one.

  1045. I purchased this from Amazon a few weeks ago and have used all attachments. The battery has held its charge and so far none of the plastic pieces have broken.<br /><br />Some positives are - The precision trimmer does a great job, gives sharp lines and leaves a nice \\"stubble\\" look. The adjustable beard trimmer works on many lengths of facial hair, including short. Very good for someone who travels, as it's pretty compact.<br /><br />Some negatives are- The mini foil shaver is only about 1\\" across, so if you wanted a \\"clean shaven\\" look it will take you a couple minutes longer than usual. My beard on my neck and goatee area grow in much thicker than on my cheeks so I have to spend a little more time in those areas if I want a close shave. It also has a different \\"head\\" than the other attachments, which I can see someone mixing up (as I did) and nearly break it.<br /><br />Other reviewers mention the plastic docking ridges breaking...I have not experienced this, as there is an obvious correct way to remove each attachment, rather than press the silver release button and try to rip the thing off. And yes, if you are a someone with thick facial hair wanting a close shave, you might have some issues with the mini foil shaver (keyword = mini)<br /><br />I paid less than $14 for this and so far have been pleased with my purchase, and I would recommend it to friends.

  1050. I have long used Norelco's products, and I love their beard trimmers. When I saw the price of this product, I was convinced it must be a really, really low quality product, but the thing surprised me in several different ways.<br /><br />First off, it comes with several different attachments and features. Here are a few thoughts on each:<br /><br />-Full Size Trimmer - Works well, just as would be expected. It functions well and without issue, which is good, because this is vital to a good beard trimmer.<br />-Mini Foil Shaver - I haven't used it yet, and will update this reviw when I do.<br />-Precision Trimmer - Works well, haven't had issues with pulling or anything of the sort.<br />-Nose, Ear & Eyebrow Trimmer - I tried it out, just for kicks. I've never used a nose hair trimmer before, and I was surprised at how well it worked. You definitely have to take your time with it, as going to fast proved to cause a bit of pulling, and that was painful.<br />-Hair Comb - A bit cheaply made, but it works well. The size/length indicator is a bit underwhelming, but functional.<br />-Beard and Mustache Comb - Mostly the same as the Hair Comb. It does its job well, but the feel of the product feels a bit cheap compared to my last Norelco beard trimmer. In the end, though, it functions much the same way, and the result is definitely acceptable.<br />-Pouch - Simple pouch, nothing more to it. Size is right and everything fits inside. Nice for travel.<br />-Washable Attachments - They are indeed very modular and very washable. You can just pull of an attachment when you are done, brush it off, rinse it, and you're done. Very nice benefit to the detachable component system.<br /><br />In the end, the product is solid. Everything that is seems to compromise it build quality seems to melt away after being used, as the results are great. I haven't had any problems with the combs slipping while using them, and I like the varied and easy to clean attachments. And at the price it iscurrently at, it's a great deal for anybody looking for a good trimming tool, especially for travel.

  1089. I've had this trimmer for about three years, the ni-cad battery eventually wore out and the trimmer would no longer hold a charge. Instead of throwing in the trash, I decided to try and replace the battery, after prying the trimmer apart with a small screwdriver I discovered that it uses a ni-cad battery the exact same size as a standard AA battery, I peeled off the soldered connections and installed a new energizer AA battery, now it works fine with no charging needed.

  1095. I've used the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] for almost 4 years now. And when I say I've used it, I mean I've used about 3-4 a year because I cut my own hair with it once a week. I also use it in a manner NOT recommended by Philips Norelco - I use it in the shower with wet hair (& conditioner for cutting ease) the majority of the time. Over 3-5 months of usage, there is no corrosion or anything else. It holds a charge wonderfully and just works.<br /><br />The only faults I've had with the G370 is that the 'spring' mechanism on the guard that allows you to vary the cutting height no longer provides the proper resistance after a couple of months/many uses - resulting in some slight varied height. Again, I used the G370 once a week+ to cut my hair as well as to manscape. This is why I usually buy 2-3 at a time so I can just chuck one into the electronics recycling bin at my local big-box store and move on.<br /><br />At $15-$20 each, the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] is worth the price. Yes, the G370 has some faults but it just works. It is a great price for around $15 on Amazon.<br /><br />Lastly, there is a product similar to this one, the [[ASIN:B000FED5DK Philips Norelco G380 All-in-1 Grooming System]] and it is almost identical to the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] except for the color and the stand but be wary because it is priced a lot higher (~$80). This is not an upgraded G370 and is not, in my opinion, worth the high price.<br /><br />4/16/13<br />One more addition is that I started to search for a 'stubble' trimmer for my face and the [[ASIN:B000FED5DU Philips Norelco G370 All-in-1 Grooming System]] without a guard works wonderfully for that! Just awesome, actually. The edges of the blades are covered enough so it maintains the short look we love and without having to be so precise with holding it.

  1170. after a few recharges the battery died but it was my fault as i left it recharging too long but...<br /><br />if you open it up with a small kitchen knife (take the head peace off and prise open the 2 sides)<br /><br />then take the old rechargeable battery out - \\"peel off\\" positive and negative connections gently with small pliers and then reconnect a normal AA battery ( white cable (+) black one (-) from your remote control for your example<br /><br />now it works perfectly and it only takes 5 mins<br /><br />of course every time it dies you will need to use a new battery but if you only use it a once a month like me thats cool as its better than throwing the whole thing away and now i dont need different adapters when i travel to other countries .<br /><br />please dont throw the rechargeable battery in the bin<br /><br />recycle it please

Versatile and effective. I have very short hair (what there is left of it), and use this to keep it trimmed. Other groomers didn't cut as evenly and were hard to get to placed like behind the ears. Also, this one lets you easily adjust the length, for trimming closer around the ears, for example. Great value, because the function is better than groomers costing 3x as much.

  1209. I've owned this trimmer for about a year and for what I paid, it does the job decently, although none of its functions do a very good job like more specialized and expensive units would.<br /><br />What I mean by this is that:<br /><br />It has a Nose Trimmer; but it kind of pulls your nose hairs rather that trim them.<br /><br />It has a Mini Shaver; but if you decided to use it to actually dry shave you'd spend at least half an hour trying to get a clean shave, your skin would be VERY irritated, and you'd still have a few hairs left that won't get clipped no matter how many passes you give.<br /><br />It has a Beard and Moustache trimmer; but the blades are rather dull and the attachments kind of flimsy and not too secure. Also, the attachment is rather large, so you can't expect to get a very precise trim.<br /><br />It has a Hair Clipper; but this is just an attachment (ie. a GUARD) which goes on top of the Beard and Moustache trimmer. I don't think I'd ever use those dull blades to cut actual head hair.<br /><br />It has a Precision and Detailing trimmer; which is probably the best accessory -its blades are somewhat sharp enough and the size is appropriate- but it doesn't have a guard to use at different lengths. This sucks because this is the accessory that I would like to use as a beard trimmer, not the other larger and grotesque attachment.<br /><br />I think they could have designed and made better decisions with this product but overall it is somewhat acceptable and the competition is not much better at best. However, if you expect a very good shave or precise trim then this product is not for you; you'd need to spend more money and get a more expensive and specific product.
  1210. The trimmer and the accessories work very well, and the charging is easy. I was disappointed by the packaging and the little satchel they gave - you basically just throw everything in rather than a somewhat organized pouch. I also found a couple of the accessories to be exceptionally loud (especially the mini shaver). I understand trimmers are generally noisy, but the basic trimmer and precision trimmer were of acceptable volume while a couple of the other accessories for some reason were surprisingly loud.<br /><br />Performance-wise, it is a good product and I would recommend it. For the price I expected slightly more power out of this than it had.<br /><br />-1 for loudness & performance, -1 for packaging & carrying case.
